title: Question 20
prompt:
The first two paragraphs of this excerpt describe Sula and Nel’s experiences during the summer of their twelfth year. How does Sula’s experience overhearing her mother’s conversation relate to the two friends’ summer?

Sula’s experiences are
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: Sula’s summer is carefree and exciting. She and Nel are discovering “beautiful, beautiful boys who dotted the landscape like jewels.” The two friends wander around barefoot, “looking for mischief.” They don’t have any troubles, only the excitement of the neighborhood boys. In contrast, Sula’s experience with her mother makes her upset and bewildered, giving her “dark thoughts.” It is neither carefree nor exciting.
